alert.note: Alert for Orange; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 6:57PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Orange and Seminole. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 655 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen in just 10 minutes. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Orlando, Oviedo, Winter Springs, Winter Park, Casselberry, Goldenrod, University Of Central Florida, Azalea Park, Conway, Belle Isle, Union Park, Orlando Executive Airport and Aloma. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
